intro: Crepis glochidiata, commonly known as the spiny sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of spiny, hairy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a single head. The plant is an annual or biennial herb that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and the species is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Botanically, it belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar composite flower structures.
